subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Could someone check my file?
msgSnippet: Thanks for your help. That was really quick! Your suggestions were very helpful. Most of them made me hit my head and say Oh yea. But I had a few questions
messageBody:
Thanks for your help. That was really quick! Your suggestions were very helpful. Most of them made me hit my head and say "Oh yea." But I had a few questions which I posted below. Some of the differences I think result in my dialect. Rather than get into the finer points of phentics and correct pronunciation, is there a dictionary for Quickscript, other than the one I link to below? I know the idea of spelling standardization has been discussed in the last few weeks (I looked at the threads on line), but I got the impression that a few Quickscript users had already compiled dictionaries.
 
Thanks a lot

Paul

PS Your comments did appear as TO, which didn't pose a problem because I just cut and pasted them into MS Word. My text below is written all in ASCII, since I don't know how to incorporate Kwikscript into my email. (Actually, I just checked and see that I just have to pull down a menu; but I doubt the font will transmit to you.)

----

You write "fair" as:

(fEr)

The dictionary at

http://home.earthlink.net/~sbartok1632/quik/qprojects/qdict/qdict.htm

has it as:

fer

dictionary.com has it phonetically as:

fɛər (or in ASCII, fE@r)
--

I thought that:

jM = V

So that in "used" becomes:

Vzd

----


I would think that appears would be

apIrz

That is, I hear the second vowel is EAt (#27)

-----

I would think months should be:

manTz

You have it

manz

Isn't there a THaw sound (#7)

---

I have a question about how to write the word anormous:

I have it as "inarmas and you have it as "inPmas." So the difference is with the the "or" (Traditional Orthography). You use one symbol for this that I can't recognize.
